ygData.subject: Re: Level 9 huh?
ygData.msgSnippet: A few things: 1) The Lake Rathe gnolls/undead right next to the SK zone line-- ahh. Brings back memories. A few friends and I used to own that place.
ygData.messageBody:
A few things:<br><br>1) The Lake Rathe
gnolls/undead right next to the SK zone line-- ahh. Brings back
memories. A few friends and I used to own that place.
LOL.<br><br>It's an easy spot to kill at actually with a good
group. Usually when Aviaks get over camped, that's where
we'd head.<br><br>The best part about it is it drops a
few low level magical weapons. Definately, you can
get lots better but my druid appreciated the dropped
staff there. Or is my memory just fuzzy. There's also a
gnoll in SK that runs around with a magic staff that
gives like +5 mana too. <br><br>2) SK and the Arena.
Get acquainted with those areas. Arena is a PVP zone.
The reason you want to know that zone is cause it is
considered a "city". Melee people can bind in there and it's
just a short swim to Arena from SK zone/Lake Rathe
zone line.<br><br>That way if something goes wrong,
ya'll don't have to wait ages for your melee to get
back. It's also a good way to build up swimming which
is good to have in certain zones.<br><br>3) "You can
kill annoying little shorties like Rondo Dunfire and
that little gnome in the pit (what's his name
again??)." <br><br>Dunfire is okay. I don't mind killing him
b/c he only gives you bad faction with Rogues and a
few other people. I forget exactly. But Rhelog (sp?)
the gnome guy. I can't believe I forget his name
cause he's so annoying-- hate him, would love to kill
him--but don't.<br><br>Why? Cause I'm afraid of the
negative gnome faction he gives out. I could be wrong or
they might have changed it. But two years ago, he gave
out some nasty Gnome City faction. I haven't been
there in forever but Steamfont is a gate I use from
time to time.<br><br>Course if you're one of the many
that love to kill Gnome guards cause they're decent
exp and loot at that level... then don't worry.
Forget what levels those guards are since I never attack
poor innocent guards protecting cities. (well other
than say Centaurs or stuff that don't seem to
acknowledge my killing off their members. ROFL. If they don't
care, why should I?)<br><br>shooman out
